intro: Cruciata ciliata f. laxa, commonly known as the loose-leaved cruciata, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The leaves are typically lobed and have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This plant is native to regions of Europe and Asia, often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
